articles.title: Kim Jong Un Goes Round Construction Site of Apartment Houses for Scientists
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Goes Round Construction Site of Apartment Houses for Scientists
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the  Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round the construction site of the apartment houses for scientists close to completion.
					 He was greeted by commanding officers of the unit participating in the construction and officials of the relevant field.
					
					 The "speed on Masik Pass" was displayed in the construction of apartment houses of 21 blocks and the project has been carried out 85 percent on an average.
					
					 He went round apartment house No. 17 whose outer tiling has been fully completed.
					
					 He looked round flats Nos. 1 and 2 on the ground floor of the apartment house No. 17.
					
					 Acquainting himself in detail with the construction of the interior, he paid deep attention to colors of wall covering, beds, desks, sofas and other furniture for each room.
					
					 He went round kitchens and wash rooms. He appreciated their good construction by using nice finishing building materials. 
					
					 Appreciating good furniture, he was very pleased to hear that furniture production units are competing with each other to provide better furniture to the apartment houses.
					
					 He told officials to fully provide all conditions so that scientists may bring with them only their personal belongings and articles for living liked by them when moving to new flats.
					
					 Apartment houses for scientists have been well designed and constructed at a high level, he said, adding he is satisfied with them and they look fashionable and impeccable.
					
					 After going round the apartment houses, he advanced the tasks to be fulfilled for winding up the project.
					
					 He called for dynamically pushing forward tree planting, creating turf and other work for greening and pavement of walk path.
					
					 After getting familiar with the construction of school, kindergarten, hospital and other public buildings and welfare and service facilities, he stressed the need to press ahead with the construction as scheduled.
					
					 He underscored the need to build the district of the apartment houses for scientists in such a way that it may be a model in building residential quarters.
					
					 The day of the completion of the apartment houses for scientists is drawing close thanks to the efforts of the builders, he said, giving an instruction to successfully wind up the construction of the apartment houses to be proud of.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Hwang Pyong So and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium now in the process of renovation.
					 He acquainted himself in detail with its renovation, looking round it.
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to hear that the builders have carried out all work 90 percent in a matter of less than five months since they started the project.
					
					 He underscored the need to build the stage better as it is used as a platform when holding conferences and other events and as spectators' seats during sports games.
					
					 Seeing the hall and spectators' seats of the stadium, he said what is important for renovating it is to provide the best convenience to people and school youth and children visiting it to watch matches.
					
					 A large electronic display should be installed not only on the side of the stadium but in the middle part of the ceiling of the stadium to be visible from all sides so that the spectators may closely watch the scores and games, he said, calling for developing Korean way a program for operating the electronic displays to be controlled by computers.
					
					 There should be different illuminations when sports games and events are held, he said, underlining the need to establish a dual illumination system in the stadium.
					
					 The Pyongyang Indoor Stadium is a building with a long history, he said, stressing the need to set a high standard and renovate it at the highest level.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the builders and officials of the relevant field engaged in the renovation work would successfully carry out their honorable tasks till the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Hwang Pyong So and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Returns Home
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Returns Home
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, returned home Tuesday after participating in the inaugural ceremony of the Iranian president at the invitation of the government of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
					 Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other suite members also flew back.
					
					They were greeted at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Vice-Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung, the Iranian  charge d'affaires a.i. here  and Tian Baozhen, Chinese charge d'affaires a.i. here.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Alassane Ouattara, president of Cote d'Ivoire, on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of its independence.
					 The message sincerely wished the president and people of Cote d'Ivoire greater successes in their work to promote national unity and achieve economic development, expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Equatorial Guinean President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Equatorial Guinean President
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the president of Equatorial Guinea.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is heading the DPRK party and government delegation, on a visit to Equatorial Guinea by President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo on Monday.

articles.title: Transgenic Plant Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Transgenic Plant Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floriculture Institute has succeeded in breeding a species of transgenic plant, making it possible to cultivate Chrysanthemum in all seasons. 
					 Highly resistant to drought and low temperature, its blossoms are bigger and more beautiful than other species of Chrysanthemum. In particular, its blooming and rooting rates are higher than others.
					
					 With no pollen, this plant is not harmful to human body and environment.
					
					 The new species, registered as transgenic organism No. 1 in the country, gives a glimpse of the nation's developing bioengineering, paving a way for further developing the gene transfer technology.

articles.title: "By Our Nation Itself" Is Only Road to Be Followed by North, South: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
"By Our Nation Itself" Is Only Road to Be Followed by North, South: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Korea should be reunified independently by concerted efforts of its nation, rejecting interference and obstruction of foreign forces, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. It goes on:
					 The U.S. seeks to keep its forces in south Korea permanently in a bid to contain big powers in Northeast Asia and carry out its strategy for dominating the region. It hopes to see the Korean nation remains divided into the north and the south and stands in confrontation.
					
					 It pretends to support the improvement of inter-Korean relations but it has laid hurdles in the way of reconciliation, unity and independent reunification of the north and the south through unreasonable interference and involvement, putting its aggressive purpose above the interests of the Korean nation and wire-pulling the south Korean ruling quarters behind scene to meet them.
					
					 The issue of Korea's reunification is an internal one of the Korean nation from A to Z and, therefore, it is responsible for its solution.
					
					 The stirring events in the June 15 era of reunification clearly proved that when the Korean people advance, holding high the banner of "By our nation itself", they can settle any problem arising in the north-south relations and certainly achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are trying to provoke the DPRK in league with foreign forces, distrusting fellow countrymen working hard to hew out the independent destiny of the nation. This is a grave obstacle in the way of improving the north-south relations.
					
					 Priority to the nation, importance to it and its unity are an expression of the idea of "By our nation itself". Giving priority to their nation, not to foreign forces, attaching importance to their nation and achieving the unity of the whole nation should become the mode of thinking and fighting traits of the Korean nation for independent reunification.
					
					 The Koreans should never allow any interference of foreign forces in the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve national reunification and their war moves for escalating the tensions on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 No force on earth can arrest the patriotic struggle of the Koreans at home and abroad to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity without fail, holding high the banner of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams U.S. Moves to Establish MD
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams U.S. Moves to Establish MD
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The United States is busy additionally deploying radars and missile defence means in different countries of the world including Japan, Guam Island, Jordan, Turkey and United Arab Emirates under the pretext of "coping with missile threat" from someone.
					 The U.S. additionally set up a high performance radar for tracking ballistic missiles in Japan, asserting that "it would intercept ballistic missiles to be launched by north Korea." It introduced six Patriot interceptor missiles in Turkey and started their operation. In June, it officially announced that it would keep as they are the Patriot interceptor missiles already deployed in Jordan.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that the U.S. is making desperate efforts to cover the world with its missile shields and attain an unchallenged edge in the field of strategic offensive weapons.
					
					 Slamming the U.S. for insisting on the deployment of missile shields not yet rounded off in different countries and regions of the world, the commentary notes:
					
					 By making much fuss about the imminent "attack of ballistic missiles" from someone, the U.S. seeks to provide a pretext and conditions for deploying  the MD in its "allies" of different regions of the world and cover the funds for operating the MD through the financial contributions from those "allies."
					
					 Its final goal is to plug potential rivals into an arms race in a bid to control the growth of defence capabilities of those countries and certainly realize its scenario for dominating the world on the basis of a military edge.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop at once its foolish action to put the world under its control.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Make Reasonable Judgment on Regional Situation
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges Japan to Make Reasonable Judgment on Regional Situation 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the Japanese government released a report calling for "increasing and supplementing combined capability to cope with missile attack from north Korea".
					 This report which reflects Japan's defense strategy to be carried out for a decade to come openly hinted "Japan's access to capability for preemptive attack", stressing the necessity of "deterrence and combined capability to cope with the increasing missile threat from north Korea". It also underlined the need to bolster up the capacities such as reinforcement of the operational foundation of the "Self-
					
					Defense Forces" and the U.S. forces in Japan to cope with the "possibility of guerrilla and special units' actions accompanied by "missile attack".
					
					 This is a provocative claim negating the root cause of the escalating regional tension. It is nothing but a broad hoax of Japan to justify its moves to turn it into a military giant which have gone beyond the danger line.
					
					 The escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula and other parts in the region is mainly attributable to the U.S. persistent hostile policy toward the DPRK and its military build-up in the region.
					
					 Recently the U.S. has worked hard to disturb all conditions and environment for the DPRK's peaceful economic construction and its efforts to improve the people's living standard, a vivid expression of the former's hostile policy toward the latter.
					
					 Japan is zealously toeing Washington's policy toward the DPRK to give spurs to its militarization and realize its ambition for overseas invasion.
					
					 In May last, the Japanese minister of Defense blustered on various occasions "Okinawa, Guam and Hawaii play important roles in ensuring security in East Asia", it is "very important to increase the U.S. military presence" in the region and the like. This is a clear indication of Japan's ulterior design.
					
					 Moreover, he said at the Asian security meeting that "north Korea's nuclear and missile development poses threat to the peace and security of the world community", openly revealing Japan's aim to bolster up its defense capabilities and exercise the right to collective self-defense.
					
					  Early in July, in particular, it once again pushed for the SDF's "access to capability for preemptive strike", claiming that it should examine "capability for preemptive strike at enemy bases" to cope with "future crisis" though the U.S. army has been in charge of it.
					
					 As a matter of fact, Japan has shown exceptional zeal in offering a base and technology as regards the expansion of the U.S. missile shield in East Asia. Taking this opportunity, Tokyo is frantically accelerating the nuclear weaponization and space militarization.
					
					 All these facts indicate that Japan's moves to strain the situation on and around the Korean Peninsula are directly linked with its scenario to meet its selfish interests by fanning up the anti-DPRK atmosphere in the region.
					
					 Japan is loudmouthed about "nuclear and missile threat from north Korea" to calm down the vigilance of Asian countries against it and its claim for access to "capability for preemptive strike" under that pretext. But no country will agree with its assertion.
					
					 This is because Japan's assertion is too unreasonable and illogical to justify its sinister aim.
					
					 As universally known, Japan offered its territory to the U.S. as an overseas logistic base for carrying out its Asia strategy after the Second World War. It along with south Korea has become a key source of the escalating tension in the region.
					
					 It is the only way of defusing the tension on the peninsula and in the region to force the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and pull its troops out of Japan and south Korea.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to behave with reason, aware that to do so would be beneficial to its security.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Accused of Releasing Biased Reports
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Accused of Releasing Biased Reports 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea issued a statement on Friday in protest against media's release of biased reports.
					 The statement recalled that the people enraged by the Intelligence Service's interference in the election took to streets across south Korea with candlelights in their hands.
					
					 The public broadcasting services, however, do not report about this at all but are intensifying the political offensive against the opposition parties, speaking for the "Saenuri Party," the statement charged, and went on:
					
					 It is a serious issue that those media persons who took issue with this attitude were fired. This is a shameless act of disregarding the people.
					
					 Those media which lend no ear to the voices of the people, oblivious of their mission, are bound to face a judgment, the statement warned.

articles.title: Elimination of Sycophantic, Traitorous Forces in S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Elimination of Sycophantic, Traitorous Forces in S. Korea Urged
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A member of the Editorial Board of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., in an article on Friday called for the elimination of sycophantic and treacherous forces in south Korea.
					 Nam Jae Jun, director of the Intelligence Service, Kim Jang Su, security chief of Chongwadae, and Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense, are the worst guys who trampled down independence and democracy of south Korean society and drove the south-north relations to the worst phase, the article said.
					
					 Their common points are that being graduates from the military academy of the Ground Force, they received orders of merit from the U.S., it noted, and went on:
					
					 The danger of war cannot but escalate on the Korean Peninsula where social democracy and future are left in darkness unless those guys are eliminated from south Korea.
					
					 The article called for ousting without fail the sycophants and traitors working with bloodshot eyes for the U.S. interests.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Carried by Russian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Carried by Russian Paper
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "On a Historic Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and the Tasks of the People's Army" was carried by the Russian paper Patriot No. 28. 
					 The work, made public on October 23, Juche 42 (1953), clarifies the significance of the historic victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and its factor and the postwar tasks of the People's Army.
					
					 The paper carried a photo of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: DPRK's Day of Victory in War Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Day of Victory in War Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition, meetings, seminars, lectures, film shows and round-table talks were held in Russia, Brazil, India, Nigeria and Mozambique between July 20 and 27.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Exhibited in the venues were works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un, photos and books showing the successes achieved by the DPRK in the building of a thriving socialist nation and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and skills of the Korean people.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu" and "Korea Today."
					
					 Present at the events were public figures of all social standings and masses of the relevant countries.
					
					 Speakers including a vice mayor of the Ryuberts City Administration of Moscow Region of Russia said that the Korean people could win a victory in the war ignited by the U.S. imperialists, thanks to the leadership of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They expressed conviction that the DPRK is sure to prosper, adding that the Korean people are firmly defending peace and security of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil said that the Korean people shattered the myth of the U.S. imperialists' "mightiness" in the Korean war for the first time in history, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Il pursued the Songun politics, turning the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power capable of beating back any formidable enemy and firmly defending socialism and the cause of global independence.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting held in Mozambique.

articles.title: DPRK's Day of Victory in War Marked by Brazilian Organizations
articles.content:
Korean People's War Victory Day Marked by Foreign Media
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Foreign media aired special programs on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The domestic and international broadcasting services and seven language broadcasting service of Guinea on July 27 aired programs introducing the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung performed in winning the victory in the war.
					
					 They said that the victory of the Korean people was the brilliant fruition of the original military tactics and superb commanding art of Kim Il Sung, adding that he set forth diverse war methods at every stage of the war, finally bringing the U.S. to its knees.
					
					 The Sakirmata TV Broadcasting Service of Nepal on the same day aired a program dealing with the personality of Kim Il Sung as an iron-willed brilliant commander.
					
					 The Syria Central TV on July 27 and 28 aired a special program showing the invincible might of the Korean People's Army and the moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to ignite a war, illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It introduced the successes achieved by the army and people of the DPRK in the building of a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Radio Broadcasting Service of this country aired a special program on July 27.

articles.title: Korean People's War Victory Day Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Korean People's War Victory Day Marked by Foreign Media
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Foreign media aired special programs on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The domestic and international broadcasting services and seven language broadcasting service of Guinea on July 27 aired programs introducing the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung performed in winning the victory in the war.
					
					 They said that the victory of the Korean people was the brilliant fruition of the original military tactics and superb commanding art of Kim Il Sung, adding that he set forth diverse war methods at every stage of the war, finally bringing the U.S. to its knees.
					
					 The Sakirmata TV Broadcasting Service of Nepal on the same day aired a program dealing with the personality of Kim Il Sung as an iron-willed brilliant commander.
					
					 The Syria Central TV on July 27 and 28 aired a special program showing the invincible might of the Korean People's Army and the moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to ignite a war, illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It introduced the successes achieved by the army and people of the DPRK in the building of a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Radio Broadcasting Service of this country aired a special program on July 27.

articles.title: DPRK's Day of Victory in War Observed by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
DPRK's Day of Victory in War Observed by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups between July 17 and 29 to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud devoted one whole page to articles titled "In three days", "The sinking  of 'moving island'" and "The end of 'undefeated division'" under the headline "July 27, the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The paper said that July 27 is the day of victory when the Korean people bested the U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world.
					
					 It gave a detailed account of the original military idea and war methods of the President, adding that the U.S. myth of "mightiness" was shattered to smithereens in the Korean war.
					
					 The paper said the world-startling myth of the DPRK's invincibility was created in the last Korean war, referring to the operation for the liberation of Taejon where the U.S. imperialists' "undefeated division" was wiped out in a few hours and the confession made by the then Chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff Bradley that the U.S. fought a wrong Korean war with a wrong rival and in the wrong place and in the wrong time.
					
					 The Nigerian newspaper Daily Sun carried a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung and cited, under the title "History's appreciation," concrete facts to prove that many figures in the world expressed reverence for Kim Il Sung, irrespective of ideology and social system, political view and religion. 
					
					 L' Avenir, the paper of Democratic Congo, in an article dealt with the exploits Kim Il Sung performed in winning the war.

articles.title: Korean People's Day of Victory in War Celebrated in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Korean People's Day of Victory in War Celebrated in Foreign Countries 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Personages of Democratic Congo and Nepal made public statements on July 23 and 26 to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo said:
					
					 The Korean people are to significantly mark on July 27 the 60th anniversary of the great victory in the war ignited by the U.S. in the last century.
					
					 When the Korean war broke out, there was so big gap in strength between the two warring parties that the U.S. generals bragged they would have breakfast in Haeju, lunch in Pyongyang and supper in Sinuiju.
					
					 All calculations of the U.S., however, were dashed.  The DPRK, less than two years old, defeated the U.S. imperialist aggression forces which claimed no defeat in the wars.
					
					 The DPRK's brilliant victory and the U.S. shameful defeat still teach the world many lessons.
					
					 First, the military and technical superiorities are not a decisive factor of the victory in the war.
					
					 Second, the ideological education plays an important role in giving play to patriotism.
					
					 Third, the people should be guided by a far-sighted leader, first of all.
					
					 Fourth, a war of aggression is bound to meet a defeat as it is in the interests of the ruling bourgeois class.
					
					 Nil Bir Singh Kansakar, vice-chairman of the Nepal-Korea Friendship Association and vice-chairman of the Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies, said the Korean people, single-mindedly united around supreme leader Kim Jong Un, will always emerge victorious just as they won the war in the 1950s.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Introduces Laudable Deed for Sino-Korea Friendship
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Instroduces Laudable Deed for Sino-Korea Friendship 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Chinese newspaper Jilin Xinwen on Aug. 1 carried an article under the title "Song of Sino-Korea friendship sung on the River Amnok" having its subtitle "Linjiang City rescues Korean inhabitants marooned on an islet due to flood on River Amnok."
					 Soldiers and citizens of Linjiang City in Jilin Province rescued three Koreans marooned on an islet by torrential rain in recent days.
					
					 On July 25, the Amnok River rose all of a sudden because of the downpour which persisted for several consecutive days.
					
					 This left the three Koreans marooned on an islet situated in the middle of the river. Violent flooding left the islet inundated, greatly threatening their lives.
					
					 Right after the border battalion in the city was informed of the situation, it reported the situation to the party committee, government and police of the city and lost no time to dispatch soldiers to the scene to learn about the disaster.
					
					 The secretary of the city party committee gave an instruction to make every possible effort to rescue them and personally went up to the hill of a village in the city facing the islet with the director of the police department of the city and discussed the operation for rescuing them.
					
					 The paper recalled that the Chinese rescue group members made persevering efforts for hours to find out the peasants of the Sangjang Co-op Farm in Junggang County and finally succeeded in safely rescuing them, risking their own lives.
					
					 It also noted that officials and other people of the city made every sincere effort to help the Koreans return home.
					
					 The story was illustrated with photos of the peasants.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam participa en toma de posesion de presidente irani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam participa en toma de posesion de presidente irani
						
Teheran, 4 de agosto (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Nam, participo el dia 4 en la ceremonia de la toma de posesion del presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, celebrada en la sede del parlamento.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises, los huespedes extranjeros y las personalidades de diversos estratos de Iran.
					
					Hubo discursos de felicitacion y presto juramento el nuevo presidente irani Hassan Rouhani.
					
					El mismo dia, Kim participo en el banquete ofrecido en nombre del presidente.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam parte de Teheran
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam parte de Teheran
						
Teheran, 5 de agosto (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 5 de esta capital luego de asistir a la ceremonia de toma de posesion del presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran cumplimentando la invitacion del gobierno irani.
					Salieron con el el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon y otros acompanantes.
					
					Ellos fueron despedidos por las personalidades de la cancilleria irani, el embajador Jo In Chol y otros miembros de la embajada coreana en Iran.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam y su comitiva regresan a Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam y su comitiva regresan a Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, regreso hoy a esta capital tras participar en la ceremonia de toma de posesion del presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran cumplimentando la invitacion del gobierno persa.
					Repatriaron con el el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon y otros acompanantes.
					
					Les recibieron en el aeropuerto Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS, Kung Sok Ung, viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, el encargado de negocios a.i. de Iran, Alireza Ghanimatpour y el encargado de negocios a.i. de China, Tian Baozhen, acreditados en Corea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a su par de Cote d´lvoire
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a su par de Cote d´lvoire
						
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio hoy un mensaje de felicitacion a Alassane Ouattara, presidente de la Republica de Cote d´Ivoire, en ocasion del 53o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais.
					En su misiva, el remitente deseo con sinceridad notables exitos del destinatario y el pueblo de ese pais por promover la unidad nacional y lograr el desarrollo economico y manifesto la conviccion de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas tambien en el futuro las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre ambos paises.
